hypothesis: The article explores the immune response of patients with COVID-19 and influenza by analyzing peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from patients with varying degrees of disease severity (mild, severe, and asymptomatic COVID-19). The goal was to uncover factors contributing to severe disease progression. Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) was employed to analyze the transcriptomes of 59,572 cells using the 10× Genomics platform. This data analysis allowed the identification of immune signatures associated with severe COVID-19 and influenza.
result: The dataset information are provided in the hypothesis.
